page.title: 01 Geography
page.content: Whitstable is a quiet, safe seaside resort in S.E.England stretching for 7 miles along Kent's North East coast.It has been called,"Kent's garden by the sea".It's below average rainfall and above average sunshine make it an ideal holiday resort.For hundreds of years it has been famous for oysters but is now a centre for international yachting and water-skiing.The harbour is quaint but busy with fishing and cargo boats. It is 59 miles from London and the nearest towns are Canterbury, Faversham & Herne Bay. Whitstable is a mixture of ancient & modern. Much of the land that used to be covered by fishermen's huts,fields & marshland is now mainly residential and industrial. It has 326 roads, closes, and avenues altogether.
